carrots.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, especially during hot weather. Avoid overwatering.
carrots.soil: Prefers well-drained, loose soil rich in organic matter.

cucumbers.water: Requires watering 3-4 times per week, keeping the soil moist but not soggy.
cucumbers.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.

tomatoes.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, especially when fruits are developing. Avoid overwatering.
tomatoes.soil: Prefers well-drained, nutrient-rich soil with a pH of 6.0-6.8.

onions.sunlight: Thrives in full sun (6-8 hours daily)
onions.water: Requires watering 1-2 times per week, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
onions.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.

peppers.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
peppers.soil: Prefers well-drained, sandy loam soil with a pH of 6.0-6.8.

lettuce.sunlight: Thrives in partial shade (4-6 hours daily)
lettuce.water: Requires watering 3-4 times per week, keeping the soil moist but not soggy.
lettuce.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.
lettuce.season: March to May, August to September

strawberries.water: Requires watering 3-4 times per week, keeping the soil moist but not soggy. Avoid overwatering the crown.
strawberries.soil: Prefers well-drained, slightly acidic soil rich in organic matter.

potatoes.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, especially during tuber formation. Avoid overwatering.
potatoes.soil: Prefers well-drained, loose soil rich in organic matter.

spinach.sunlight: Thrives in partial shade (4-6 hours daily)
spinach.water: Requires watering 3-4 times per week, keeping the soil consistently moist.
spinach.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.
spinach.season: March to May, September to November

broccoli.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, keeping the soil moist but not waterlogged.
broccoli.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.
broccoli.season: March to June, September to November

zucchini.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, keeping the soil moist but not waterlogged.
zucchini.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.

peas.sunlight: Thrives in partial shade to full sun (4-8 hours daily)
peas.water: Requires watering 2-3 times per week, keeping the soil consistently moist.
peas.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.
peas.season: March to May, September to November

turnips.sunlight: Requires full sun to partial shade (4-6 hours daily)
turnips.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil evenly moist.
turnips.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.
turnips.season: March to May, August to October

horseradish.sunlight: Thrives in partial shade to full sun (4-8 hours daily)
horseradish.water: Requires moderate watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
horseradish.soil: Prefers well-drained, sandy loam soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.
horseradish.season: March to May, September to November

rhubarb.sunlight: Thrives in partial shade to full sun (4-8 hours daily)
rhubarb.water: Requires moderate watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
rhubarb.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 5.5-6.5.

blueberries.sunlight: Requires full sun to partial shade (4-6 hours daily)
blueberries.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil evenly moist.
blueberries.soil: Prefers well-drained, acidic soil with a pH of 4.5-5.5.

beetroots.sunlight: Requires full sun to partial shade (4-6 hours daily)
beetroots.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil evenly moist.
beetroots.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.
beetroots.season: March to May, August to October

asparagus.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
asparagus.soil: Prefers well-drained, sandy soil with a pH of 6.5-7.5.

rosemary.water: Requires moderate watering, allowing the soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
rosemary.soil: Prefers well-drained, sandy soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.
rosemary.season: Year-round, but slows growth in winter

thyme.water: Requires moderate watering, allowing the soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
thyme.soil: Prefers well-drained, sandy soil with a pH of 6.0-8.0.
thyme.season: Year-round, but slows growth in winter

basil.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil evenly moist.
basil.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.

parsley.sunlight: Thrives in partial shade to full sun (4-8 hours daily)
parsley.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
parsley.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.

oregano.water: Requires moderate watering, allowing the soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
oregano.soil: Prefers well-drained, sandy soil with a pH of 6.0-8.0.

mint.sunlight: Requires partial shade to full sun (4-8 hours daily)
mint.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
mint.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0.

cilantro.sunlight: Requires partial shade to full sun (4-8 hours daily)
cilantro.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
cilantro.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5.

chili.water: Requires regular watering, keeping the soil evenly moist.
chili.soil: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil with a pH of 6.0-6.5.
